provenance.name: National Trust, Petworth House
provenance.note: Painted by Blake for the Countess of Egremont, probably c. 1800-05; by descent to Lord Leconfield; John Wyndham, later Lord Egremont; given by Egremont to Her Majesty's Treasury in lieu of estate taxes in 1957 and retained by the National Trust at Petworth House, Sussex.

desc.objtitle:
Satan Calling Up His Legions,
Object 1 (Butlin 662)

objnote.p: Blake included the version of this painting now in the Victoria and Albert Museum (Butlin 661) in his 1809 exhibition, number IX in the accompanying *Descriptive Catalogue*. In the heading to the description of that work he refers to this painting now at Petworth House (Butlin 662) as "a more perfect Picture, afterward executed for a Lady of high rank" (page 54).
